intro: Aciotis anomala, commonly known as the wild dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features basal leaves that are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and produce small, wind-dispersed seeds. Aciotis anomala is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
